main.name: Jason
main.bio: I'm a motivated Software Developer based in Vancouver, Canada, currently pursuing a B.Sc. in Computer Science at Simon Fraser University. I have experience working in both HCM and cloud fintech legal industries, where I’ve contributed to designing and implementing complex solutions for critical systems. As I seek new graduate opportunities, I’m eager to apply and refine my skills by tackling challenging problems and building innovative software. I thrive in collaborative environments and am committed to lifelong learning in the ever-evolving tech landscape. Download my resume for more details!

resume.skillmessage: I'm familiar with a wide variety of technologies

work.description: At Clio, a leading cloud-based legal technology company, I optimized Clio Payments, reducing payment collection times by 35% for 50,000+ law firms through Ruby on Rails development and Stripe integration. I enhanced financial and data security across five regions by aligning Clio Payments with KYC, PCI-DSS, and GDPR compliance standards. Managing $10M+ CAD in daily transactions, I led incident response efforts and handled on-call rotations to ensure seamless payment processing. To maintain system stability, I leveraged ELK, Datadog, and Bugsnag for proactive issue detection, supporting seven+ successful project releases.

At UKG, I led the Custom Branding project for UKG Pro, enabling 80,000+ customers to personalize their product suite with logos, brand colors, and slogans using Angular and Java Spring Boot. I boosted page performance by 30% and created a more cohesive UI by integrating Design Language System components, replacing outdated image-based elements. To enhance scalability, I developed RESTful APIs with Spring and implemented reactive state management using NgRx and RxJS. Additionally, I increased test coverage to over 90% by leveraging JUnit, Selenium, and Jasmine, ensuring robust and reliable software.

education.degree: Bachelors of Science in Computing Science
education.description: Relevant Coursework: Data Structures & Algorithms, Operating Systems, Database Systems, Data Science, Computer Networking, User Interface Design, Requirements Engineering

projects.title: Budget Buddy
projects.language: ReactJS, Java Spring Boot, MySQL, AWS
projects.description: Budget Buddy is a full-stack web application designed to help users track their monthly expenses, log transactions, and manage their finances efficiently. The frontend, built with React, is deployed on AWS S3, while the backend, powered by Java Spring Boot and MySQL, runs on AWS Elastic Beanstalk with RDS for database management. Users can filter payments by month, year, and category, making it easy to analyze spending patterns. With a seamless and responsive UI, Budget Buddy simplifies financial tracking for better money management.

projects.title: SmartCommute
projects.language: Python, Twilio API, OpenWeatherMap API, TrueWay Directions API
projects.description: SmartCommute, hosted on PythonAnywhere, is a commuter's application that delivers daily SMS notifications with real-time travel recommendations. Using the Twilio API, the application sends timely alerts based on weather conditions from OpenWeatherMap and traffic data from the TrueWay Directions API. Whether it’s rain, snow, or heavy traffic, SmartCommute helps users plan their commute efficiently by providing up-to-date insights to ensure a smoother and safer journey.

projects.title: Computational Blockchain
projects.description: Computational Blockchain is a high-performance blockchain mining implementation that utilizes a concurrent producer-consumer work queue to efficiently distribute SHA-256 proof computations across multiple worker threads. Built in Rust, the system optimizes resource allocation by dynamically managing workload distribution and draining the queue upon discovering the first valid proof, reducing unnecessary computations. This approach enhances mining efficiency and showcases effective concurrency management for blockchain applications.

projects.title: UFC Predictive Modelling
projects.description: UFC Predictive Modelling is a machine learning project designed to forecast fight outcomes and analyze athlete performance. Using historical fight data, the model employs a K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN) classifier to predict match winners with 70% accuracy. Additionally, a regression model was developed to estimate fighters' win-loss ratios, achieving a 0.96 coefficient of determination (R²), demonstrating strong predictive power. Data visualization with Seaborn helped uncover key trends and insights in fight statistics.

projects.title: Galactic Grease Monkey
projects.description: The first big team project I led. An exciting 2D arcade game in which the user must navigate around black holes, aliens, and satellites to collect diamonds and spaceship parts to achieve high scores. We used the A* search algorithm to implement pathfinding, the Java Abstract Window Toolkit to render graphics, and the KeyListener interface to handle events.

projects.title: Poker Game
projects.description: This is a Java CLI poker game that recognizes all the unique poker hands, determines the winners of any game, and displays the player rankings accordingly. The project was designed with highly cohesive classes, validated with automated script testing in Python, and documented with Javadoc.

projects.title: My Personal Website
projects.description: The website you are viewing was developed in ReactJS and deployed using Github Pages. The contact form makes use of the EmailJS library to increase engagement.
